intro: Macairea hoehnei, commonly known as the Hoehne's macairea, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
